name: vscode-neovim
description: Vim mode for VSCode, powered by Neovim

vscode-neovim.neovimPath.title: Neovim path
vscode-neovim.neovimPath.markdownDescription: *Windows, OSX, Linux in Neovim path settings won`t work if this setting is set* Full path to Neovim executable. If you have enabled `useWSL` setting, specify the Linux path to nvim executable instead.
vscode-neovim.neovimPath.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated. Remove this setting and use neovimExecutablePaths.win32/linux/darwin instead. If you continue to use this setting, keep in mind this setting takes precedence over neovimExecutablePaths.windows/linux/darwin and those settings won't work. If you want them to work, just remove this setting from your settings.json or make its input box in User Settings empty

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.win3.title: Neovim executable path on Windows
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.win3.markdownDescription:
Full path to Neovim executable that should be used by the extension if running VS Code on Windows.  
Example:  
C:\tools\neovim\Neovim\bin\nvim.exe (if you installed using Chocolatey)  
If you want to use Windows Subsystem for Linux, enable the `useWSL` setting and set `neovimExecutablePaths.linux` instead

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.darw.title: Neovim executable path on OSX
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.darw.description: Full path to Neovim executable that should be used by the extension if running VS Code on OSX.

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.linu.title: Neovim executable path on Linux (and in WSL)
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.linu.markdownDescription:
Full path to Neovim executable that should be used by the extension if running VS Code on Linux or WSL. If `useWSL` setting is checked, vscode-neovim will look for this path in default WSL distro  
Example:  
/usr/bin/nvim

vscode-neovim.neovimInitPath.title: Custom init.vim path
vscode-neovim.neovimInitPath.description: Full path to custom neovim init file, equals to startup option -u. If checked useWSL flag specify a Linux path. You can also use exists('g:vscode') in your init.vim to check if neovim is being run in vscode and share init file between neovim/vscode
vscode-neovim.neovimInitPath.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated. Use neovimInitVimPaths.win32/linux/darwin instead. If you continue to use this setting, keep in mind this setting takes precedence over neovimInitVimPaths.win32/linux/darwin and those settings won't work. If you want them to work, just remove this setting from your settings.json or make its input box in User Settings empty

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.win32.title: Custom init.vim path on Windows
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.win32.markdownDescription: Full path to custom neovim init.vim file on Windows, equals to startup option `-u`. If the `useWSL` setting is checked, the value of the `neovimInitVimPaths.linux` setting will be used to find the init.vim file instead. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your init.vim to check if neovim is being run in vscode and share init file between neovim/vscode

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.darwin.title: Custom init.vim path on OSX
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.darwin.markdownDescription: Full path to custom neovim init.vim file on OSX, equals to startup option `-u`. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your init.vim to check if neovim is being run in vscode and share init file between neovim/vscode

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.linux.title: Custom init.vim path on Linux
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.linux.markdownDescription: Full path to custom neovim init.vim file on Linux or default WSL distro, equals to startup option `-u`. If the `useWSL` setting is checked, this path will be used to find `init.vim` in Windows Subsystem for Linux. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your init.vim to check if neovim is being run in vscode and share init file between neovim/vscode

vscode-neovim.neovimWidth.title: Neovim width
vscode-neovim.neovimWidth.description: Neovim viewport width. Increase if you're working with long lines and have horizontal scroll problems. Larger values will affect neovim performance

vscode-neovim.completionDelay.title: Completion Delay
vscode-neovim.completionDelay.description: The delay in ms until the wildmenu completions are shown. This is to not bother you when you write :w or :noh.

vscode-neovim.neovimViewportHeightExtend.title: Neovim viewport height extend
vscode-neovim.neovimViewportHeightExtend.description: How much to extend neovim viewport on each side beyond vscode editor size. Increase if you are not seeing decorations or highlights on the edges of the editor.

vscode-neovim.useCtrlKeysForNormalMode.deprecationMessage: Use vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForNormalMode instead (Set it to empty)
vscode-neovim.useCtrlKeysForNormalMode.description: Use Ctrl keys in normal/visual/etc...(except insert) modes

vscode-neovim.useCtrlKeysForInsertMode.deprecationMessage: Use vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForInsertMode instead (Set it to empty)
vscode-neovim.useCtrlKeysForInsertMode.description: Use Ctrl keys in insert mode

vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForNormalMode.description: Enabled Ctrl keys in normal/visual/etc...(except insert) modes

vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForInsertMode.description: Enabled Ctrl keys in insert mode

vscode-neovim.editorLangIdExclusions.description: Will disable all keyboard shortcuts when the current editorLangId is in the list

vscode-neovim.useWSL.markdownDescription: Use neovim installed in [default WSL distro](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/basic-commands#run-a-specific-linux-distribution-from-powershell-or-cmd). If you enable this setting, specify the path to the neovim executable installed in WSL `neovimExecutablePaths.linux` setting.

vscode-neovim.revealCursorScrollLine.markdownDescription: If 'true' reveals the cursor when scrolling by line and if it is outside view port

vscode-neovim.logOutputToConsole.description: When on, print log messages to vscode developer console (not output channel!)

vscode-neovim.highlightGroups.highlights.title: Highlight Groups Configuration
vscode-neovim.highlightGroups.highlights.description: Define colors for various VIM highlight groups. Values are text decoration properties object

backgroundColor.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

color.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

border.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

borderColor.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

textDecoration.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

vscode-neovim.normalSelectionDebounceTim.description: Debounce time used to synchronize selection from VSCode to Nvim, typically referring to cursor movement

vscode-neovim.mouseSelectionDebounceTime.description: Debounce time for synchronizing mouse selection. Set to 0 to disable synchronization

commands.title: Neovim: send key to neovim, syncing if in insert mode
Neovim: send multiple keys to neovim, used for insert mode paste
Neovim send escape key to neovim, or other keys that will exit insert mode
